** Vlad cleared his throat as he looked on through the darkness, the exact 
same thing he had been doing for the last three quarters of an hour.
The animal at his side, named Chesta, whiled and rubbed her head against his 
elbow. Obviously uncomfortable.
Vlad sat back on his heels and looked down at her, patting her head before 
returning his optics to the darkness beyond the pod.**

� Don�t worry. There has to be someone here�but I�m not going to wait all 
day to find out.�

** And with that Vlad stood up as tall as he could in the pod and began to 
work on the hatch, hearing a hiss of air as the seal broke and felt cool 
drops of water splatter onto his face as the hatch lifted. Peeking his head 
up and out of the clear sphere as he pushed the hatch back, smelling the 
familiar scent of metal and rust.
It was a ship of some sort he was in, peering through the darkness to see 
the slight outlines of a door on the other side of the room.
Vlad then looked down to see some sort of bot laying on the floor by the 
pod, one he remembered as the one whom had dragged him into this ship. But 
Vlad only regarded him as nothing, hauling himself out of the pod and 
feeling it roll under his weight. The hatch moving until its� edge was only 
a few inches off the ground. Vlad catching himself with his feet.
Chesta easily jumped out and shook herself, then settling down at an easy 
slump as Vlads� feet.
Vlad sighed and looked around the dark room, eventually walking over to the 
door and running his fingers over it, stepping back as the door opened and 
filtered in light. His optics blinded by the light.*
